title: Who was the first famous musician? - Quora

response.answer_text: The first music may have been invented in Africa and then evolved to become a fundamental constituent of human life, using various different materials to make various instruments. Here, I copy paste the main answer about first famous musician from the previous Quora answer of same type questions which was written by ‘Wednesday Mac'. First famous musician: Perhaps the castrato Farinelli (24 January 1705 – 16 September 1782), if you mean a celebrity in terms of a reputation in multiple countries, bringing his audience to tears when he sang, commanding vast sums to perform, captivating women regardless he was a castrato, a superb public personae (always kind and even-tempered as opposed other castrati), and in great demand by royalty. Also a technique that astonished and never failed, whether he was singing solo or in opera, in a voice that cannot be recreated.

First you have to define “famous”. The geographical area. How well was he/she known. The length of dominance etc. Even then, could that claim be disputed?
